BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: GREAT PLAINS TRIBAL LEADERS HEALTH BOARD

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Our Vision:The Great Plains Tribal Leaders Health Board's ("GPTLHB") vision is that all tribal nations and communities in the Great Plains will reach optimum health and wellness through lasting partnerships with health organizations and embrace culturally significant values that are empowered by tribal sovereignty.United under the GPTLHB umbrella, our tribal constituents are able to compete for population-based grants and resources that may not otherwise be available to them. Through GPTLHB, tribes are empowering themselves to address their individual health resource needs in an effective way.Mission:Our mission is to improve the wellness of our people by providing quality healthcare, public health services, advocacy, and support in partnership with the tribal-nations of the Great Plains area.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Our Vision:The Great Plains Tribal Leaders Health Board's ("GPTLHB") vision is that all tribal nations and communities in the Great Plains will reach optimum health and wellness through lasting partnerships with health organizations and embrace culturally significant values that are empowered by tribal sovereignty.United under the GPTLHB umbrella, our tribal constituents are able to compete for population-based grants and resources that may not otherwise be available to them. Through GPTLHB, tribes are empowering themselves to address their individual health resource needs in an effective way.Mission:Our mission is to improve the wellness of our people by providing quality healthcare, public health services, advocacy, and support in partnership with the tribal-nations of the Great Plains area.
IRS990.Desc: PURSUANT TO A SECTION 638 CONTRACT WITH THE INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE, THE GPTLHB MANAGES AND OPERATES THE OYATE HEALTH CENTER IN RAPID CITY, S. DAKOTA. AMONG OTHER SERVICES, THE CLINIC PROVIDES WALK-IN PRIMARY AND URGENT CARE MEDICAL SERVICES TO APPROXIMATELY 22,000 NATIVE AMERICAN PATIENTS IN THE GREATER RAPID CITY AREA. APPROXIMATELY 50,000 OUTPATIENT VISITS OCCURRED DURING ITS FISCAL YEAR ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2021. THE HEALTH CENTER ALSO INCLUDES A FULL SERVICE PHARMACY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: COMMUNITY HEALTH PROGRAMS:Serving as a liaison between the Great Plains Tribes and the various Health and Human Services divisions, including the Great Plains Area Indian Health Service, the Great Plains Tribal Leaders Health Board works to reduce public health disparities and improve the health and wellness of the American Indian peoples who are members of the 18 Great Plains tribal nations and communities. We achieve this by: o Assisting with tribal participation in the consultation process with the Health and Human Services divisions including the Indian Health Service; o Assisting the various Health and Human Services divisions with the distribution of health resources for tribal members; o Advocating for tribal interests and needs at state, regional, and national levels for health-related concerns and initiatives; o Providing technical assistance to tribes in the development and improvement of tribal health programs; o Representing GPTLHB and member tribes before the Congress of the United States at hearings and meetings regarding health issues for American Indian peoples; and o Providing policy analysis and recommendations related to Indian Health Care concerns, to tribally appointed representatives designated to deliver advocacy and testimony to Congressional and Executive Branch leadership.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE GREAT PLAINS AREA

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ENTITIES PROVIDING TRIBAL HEALTH PROGRAMS IN THE GREAT PLAINS REGION RECEIVE GRANTS FROM THE ORGANIZATION. PROGRAM MANAGERS MAKE SITE VISITS AND REVIEW PROGRAM REPORTS TO MONITOR THE SUCCESSOF THE VARIOUS PROGRAMS. THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS THAT DEFRAY THE COST FOR STUDENTS WHO ARE PURSUING HIGH-DEMAND HEALTHCARE TRAINING OR POST-SECONDARY HEALTHCARE EDUCATION AT A QUALIFIED HEALTHCARE TRAINING PROGRAM. STUDENTS MUST DEMONSTRATE ACADEMIC MERIT AND FINANCIAL NEED. THE ORGANIZATION VERIFIES ENROLLMENT IN A QUALIFIED PROGRAM PRIOR TO DISBURSING ANY SCHOLARSHIP. STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO PARTICIPATE IN MENTORSHIP MEETINGS AND CAREER SUCCESS CLASSES AS WELL AS COMPLETE SURVEYS. HONORARIUMS ARE PROVIDED TO DRUMMERS, DANCERS, OR SPECIAL PRESENTERS WHO APPEAR AT MEETINGS OR CONFERENCES ORGANIZED BY THE ORGANIZATIONS. ANY HONARIUM IS DISTRIBUTED AT THE EVENT SO ADDITIONAL MONITORING IS NOT REQUIRED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PRIOR TO FILING THIS AMENDED 2020 FORM 990, IT WAS REVIEWED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S INTERIM CONTROLLER, SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCIAL OPERATIONS, AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICTS POLICY IS REVIEWED WITH THE DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS ANNUALLY. EACH DIRECTOR AND OFFICER IS REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE RELATED PARTIES AND ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS NEAR THE BEGINNING OF EACH FISCAL YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S CEO IS EVALUATED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, WHICH IS A BOARD COMMITTEE. PRIOR TO APPROVING ANY CHANGE TO THE CEO'S COMPENSATION, THE COMMITTEE IS PROVIDED WITH REFERENCE MATERIALS FROM RELEVENT SOURCES ALONG WITH A COMPENSATION EVALUATION PREPARED BY AN OUTSIDE COMPENSATION CONSULTANT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AN OUTSIDE COMPENSATION CONSULTANT PERFORMS AN INITIAL COMPENSATION EVALUATION. THE CEO EVALUATES EACH OFFICER AND AN OFFICER EVALUATES EACH KEY EMPLOYEE. COMPENSATION CHANGES, IF ANY, ARE BASED ON EMPLOYEE PERFORMANCE AND CHANGES IN THE COST OF LIVING. ANY PERFORMANCE COMPENSATION IS APPROVED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. THE ORGANIZATION'S ANNUAL AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE ALSO INCLUDED WITH FORM 990.

THIS AMENDED RETURN INCLUDES AMOUNTS FROM GREAT PLAINS TRIBAL LEADERS HEALTH BOARD'S AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AS OF AND FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2021. THE FISCAL YEAR 2021 AUDIT WAS COMPLETED SUBSEQUENT TO THE EXTENDED FILING DUE DATE OF THE ORIGINALLY FILED 2020 FORM 990.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART IV, SECTION A, ITEM 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CHAIR OR PRESIDENT OF EACH OF THE EIGHTEEN MEMBER TRIBES IS THE APPLICABLE TRIBE'S MEMBER OF THE GPTLHB'S GOVERNING BODY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AN EXTERNAL CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTANT PREPARES FORM 990, WHICH IS THEN REVIEWED BY THE CONTROLLER, CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER.

GPTLHB IS A PARTY TO A RENEWABLE CONTRACT WITH TWO INDIAN TRIBES, SPECIFICALLY, THE CHEYENNE RIVER SIOUX AND OGLALA SIOUX TRIBES. THE CONTRACT ASSIGNS EXCLUSIVE RESPONSIBILITY FOR MANAGING AND OPERATING THE OYATE HEALTH CENTER, LOCATED IN RAPID CITY, SOUTH DAKOTA, TO THE GPTLHB. A REPRESENTATIVE FROM EACH OF THESE TWO TRIBES IS ALSO A VOTING MEMBER OF THE GPTLHB'S EIGHTEEN MEMBER BOARD OF DIRECTORS.
